critique:
This document is a short announcement regarding the United States Civil Service Commission's authorization to test the qualifications of applicants for designation for appointment in the United States Military or Naval Academies on nomination of any Member of Congress. It was issued by the White House on September 7, 1932.

Ideological Tilt: 0. This document does not express any clear ideological leaning. It is a procedural announcement.
Immigration Approach: 0. This document has nothing to do with immigration.
Executive Power: 0. This document does not expand or restrict executive power. It simply authorizes the Civil Service Commission to conduct tests.
Federalism: 0. This document does not significantly impact the balance of power between the federal government and the states.
National Security vs. Civil Liberties: 0. This document does not directly address national security or civil liberties.
Economic Regulation: 0. This document has no impact on economic regulation.
Social Inclusion: 0. This document does not promote or hinder social inclusion. It is neutral in this regard.
